𓃯 󳣑 󳣒 󳣓 󳊚 󳥭 󳥮 󳥯 󳥰 󳥱 󳥲 󳥳 󳥴 󳥵 󳥶 󳥷 󳥸 󳥹 󳥬 rhino!

𓄁 ḫꜣb hippo 𓆼 𓄿 𓃀 𓃯 Chipo 𓂧 𓃀 𓃯 •δabra < tòbárì ≈ טַבּוּר tabúr

𓄁 ẖpꜣ hippo in 𓄡 𓊪 𓐎 #ẖpꜣ ϧⲉⲗⲡⲓ xelpi "navel(string)" ☑

𓄁 צַפְרָא ṣap̄rā 𓄡 𓊪 𓐎

𓂧𓃀𓃯 Chipo > hippo

𓂧𓃀𓃯 Depp ⇔ 𓃯𓃀𓂧 hippopotamus reverse

𓂧𓃀𓃯 •dobrin > dṑrinā

𓂧𓃀𓃯 ≈ 󳧖 𒁕𒁍 da-buʳ דבא debā the Bear 𒈚𒋚 dim₃-šah ?

𓂧𓃀𓃯 ≈ djambšau 𓃟 𒈚𒂄 dim₃šah₂ "hippo"

𓂧𓃀𓃯 ≈ champsai 𓆊 𒁮𒋚 dam-šah تمساح tamsãh تمساح temsâh تِمْسَاح timsāḥ تمسيح tamsīḥ ⲉⲙⲥⲁϩ

𓈖𓉔𓋴𓃯 Ni'hos Nile Horse Nilpferd nijlpaard فَرَس النَّهْر faras an-nahr !!

𓆼𓄿𓃀𓃯 Cerberus
𓂧𓃀𓃯 ⇔ 𓂧𓃀𓄏 horn (of animal) δabor Derb Horn ⇔ 𓄛 ?

𓂧𓃀𓄏 and 𓂝𓃀𓄏𓏤 combined support a reading of chippo > hippo

𓃯𓃀𓂧 בְּהֵמוֹת behemót 河马 hémǎ бегемо́т begemót potamus բեգեմոնտ begemont (Bach-Märe)

𓄿 𓊃 𓃀 𓄁 asb 𓃗 اسب 𓊩

E25 𓃯 ipher : hippo NilPferd ivory E26 𓃰 ElEphant 'pi@PERS el'Vieh? alba 𓍋Ypi? ⇔ 𓃯 ipher : hippo << Kiefer-Tier𓆭𓄒Jaw.guar high-fahrn-- hieben- 𓍋 hiefen- helfen'tier

𓂧𓃀𓃯 𓈖𓉔𓋴𓃯 dṑrinā النَّهْر Rhein Tier :
𓂧𓃀𓃯 dariyāī bhoṛā दरियाई घोड़ा dariyāī ghoṛā दरियाई (dariyāī, “of the river” + घोड़ा (ghoṛā, “horse)

It is unlikely that Egyptians used such a long name for such a common animal. What might have happened is phono semantic matching and calques by foreiners/neighbors.

𓆼𓄿𓃀𓃯 Keifer ⇔ Keiler wild boar 𓂧𓃀𓃯 ≠ 𓂋𓂋𓇋𓃟 ≠ bear 🐻
𓆼𓄿𓃀𓃯 Keifer ⇔ 𓆼𓄿𓃀𓃀𓄒𓄒 Kiefer > Jibher:jbḥ=𓄑 ivory Hieb, heap ⇔ 𓂝𓃀𓄏𓏤 horn
